titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Williamsburgh City Fire Insurance Company policy to Theodore F. Jackson 1978.090
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:32 +0000.

did.unittitle: Williamsburgh City Fire Insurance Company policy to Theodore F. Jackson
did.abstract: Fire insurance policy issued to Theodore F. Jackson from the Williamsburgh City Fire Insurance Company, dated May 1, 1899. The policy was for a theater at 778-774 Driggs Avenue, between Third and Smith Streets. Theodore F. Jackson (1830-1913) was a prominent lawyer in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Williamsburgh City Fire Insurance Company policy to Theodore F. Jackson, 1978.090, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: BIographical Note
bioghist.p: Theodore F. Jackson (1830-1913) was a prominent lawyer in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Williamsburg. He studied law in Manhasset, Long Island under Judge Onderdonk and in 1852 was admitted to the bar. He formed a partnership with Paul J. Fish in Williamsburg, which was dissolved in 1860. After practicing alone for 14 years, Jackson formed a partnership with Joseph A. Burr in 1874. In 1881, Jackson was appointed Registar of Arrears by Brooklyn Mayor Seth Low, and in 1889 he was elected Comptroller. He was also Director of the First National Bank of the City of Brooklyn, the Williamsburgh Trust Co., the Long Island Loan and Trust Co., and the New York and East River Ferry Co., of which he was also President. He was also a member of the Sons of the Revolution and the Hamilton and Hanover Clubs. Jackson retired in 1893.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fire insurance policy issued to Theodore F. Jackson from the Williamsburgh City Fire Insurance Company, dated May 1, 1899. The policy was for a theater at 778-774 Driggs Avenue, between Third and Smith Streets.
